page.title: 04The Alderney Court
page.content: In the Court there are seven jurats(the equivalent of English Magistrates )- five men and two women who are appointed by the Crown. If someone is caught drinking too much it is called a criminal offence and the maximum fine is 25 pence.(an old Norman Law that has not been repealed).A civil case is when the Court deals with debts owing or people arguing.When there is a case in Court three jurats have to be present.There is a meeting in the Court every Thursday afternoon and every month one afternoon is put aside for criminal cases.Larceny,rape,murder,causing bodily harm and anything serious have to be tried in Guernsey.Guernsey is also the first Court of Appeal.The system of law is a mixture of English and Norman.
